key_points: President-elect Joe Biden will not take the Amtrak to his inauguration due to security concerns.
The decision was influenced by the proximity of Union Station to the US Capitol, now heavily fortified following recent unrest.
Biden initially wanted to proceed with inauguration plans, including the Amtrak ride, despite concerns over COVID-19 and the Capitol riot.
Security concerns have grown following the Capitol attack, which resulted in five deaths.
Biden received a briefing on potential extremist violence from the FBI, the Secret Service, and his national security team.
The transition team is closely coordinating with the Trump administration on security preparations.
Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris will take their oaths outside the US Capitol in a scaled-down event.
More than 20,000 National Guard troops might be deployed in Washington for inauguration security.
Officials are considering raising the terrorism threat level for the inauguration.
Senate hearings and confirmations for Biden's homeland security and defense secretary nominees are being expedited.
